extends java.lang.Object
    Created by jessie on 15-02-05.

    • Field Detail

      • uri

        protected java.net.URI uri

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest()
        Creates an HTTP Request object. This object handles parsing of the actual HTTP request. Currently it handles GETs and POSTs.

    • Method Detail

      • getMethod

        public HttpRequest.Method getMethod()
        Returns a Method enum object that corresponds with the requests HTTP method
        Returns:
        the HTTP method enum
        See Also:
        HttpRequest.Method

      • getURI

        public java.net.URI getURI()
        Returns a URI object that is set to be the parsed value of the HTTP request path. This can either be the fully qualified URL or a relative path
        Returns:
        URI object with the value set to the parsed HTTP path.
        See Also:
        URI

      • getBody

        public java.lang.String getBody()
        Returns the parsed HTTP body. If the request has no body (for a POST with no body or a GET for example) this will return null. This body will already have any encoding options applied (i.e. GZip).
        Returns:
        The HTTP request body

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the HTTP version number. Currently will always be `HTTP/1.1`
        Returns:
        The HTTP version

      • getHeadersCollection

        public java.util.Collection<Header> getHeadersCollection()
        Returns a Collection of all request headers
        Returns:
        A Collection of all request headers
        See Also:
        Header

      • getHeadersMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Header> getHeadersMap()
        Returns a map of all headers. The key of the map is the Header name and the value is the Header object.
        Returns:
        a Map of all Headers
        See Also:
        Header, Map

      • parseRequest

        public void parseRequest(java.io.BufferedReader in)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         NotImplementedException,
                         InvalidRequestException
        This function parses the HTTP request method, path, version, headers, and body and sets any parsed info to the to the current HttpRequest object.
        Parameters:
        in - the BufferedReader containing the raw HTTP request
        Throws:
        NotImplementedException - thrown when the parsed HTTP method is not supported
        InvalidRequestException - thrown when the parsed HTTP is incorrect or malformed
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the BufferedReader throws an exception
        See Also:
        BufferedReader
